StringTable.Label: EXP4_M1_Terran_Dec
StringTable.String: Terrans are the inventors of hyperdrive and the youngest race on the galactic stage. Although committed diplomats, Terrans have a militaristic streak that has taken many by surprise.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M1_Terran_StartupDescription
StringTable.String:
D.L. Bradley has returned from the pocket universe and freed Earth. But the war has only just begun. Bradley, with the terrible power of the Bane at his command, has begun a crusade that will only end when the Drengin Empire has been completely wiped from the galaxy.
But the mysterious Thalan Contingency has come forward with a chilling prophecy: this crusade will result in the utter destruction of the galaxy. Despite this warning, Bradley has begun to make his strike into the heart of the Drengin Empire.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M1_Terran_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String:
The Thalan claim that proof of the upcoming Apocalypse can be found on an ancient Precursor prison world. What this proof is exactly, they weren't clear but it deserves further investigation.
D.L. Bradley has dispatched a small fleet to this out-of-the-way sector to investigate the Thalan's claims, while he continues into Drengin territory.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M1_Drath_Dec
StringTable.String: Mysterious creatures who love to move in the shadows, the Drath are masters of subterfuge and manipulation. Rumored to be behind every major conflict in the galaxy, though it's just as likely they spread those rumors themselves.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M1_Drath_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Drath have bonuses to diplomatic and economic skills but are hampered with a slow natural birth rate.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M1_Korath_Dec
StringTable.String: The Korath Clan is made up from formerly elite Drengin warriors, who differentiated themselves from their brethren by both the ferocity of their desire to wipe out non-Drengin races and their ability to actually do so.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M1_Korath_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Korath have bonuses to soldiering and ship combat, though their excessively militaristic nature limits their economic development somewhat.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M2_Terran_Dec
StringTable.String: Terrans are the inventors of hyperdrive and the youngest race on the galactic stage. Although committed diplomats, Terrans have a militaristic streak that has taken many by surprise.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M2_Terran_StartupDescription
StringTable.String:
The appearance of the Last Dreadlord on Yiven III has brought Colonel Casey to Altaria, also known as the ancient world of Elemental. Once there she has to find the last Shard of the Telenanth and bring it to D.L. Bradley or all is lost. Unfortunately, the Yor have captured Altaria and fortified the surrounding space with special hyperdrive disrupting starbases. This will make a fast retrieval of the Shard difficult, if not impossible.
Colonel Casey must fight her way through the Yor fortifications and secure the last Shard before D.L. Bradley reaches the heart of Drengin Territory and seals the fate of the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M2_Terran_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Terran Alliance has secured two colonies within striking distance of Altaria. Will the resources of two worlds be enough to overcome the Yor Singularity?

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M2_Yor_Dec
StringTable.String: The Yor are a race of sentient artificial beings. They have no need for crude means for reproduction and consumption, and can instead build citizens to inhabit their worlds.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M2_Yor_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Yor are highly productive and capable of building large fleets of self-repairing vessels. They're profoundly unpopular, and few races opt to befriend them. Unlike organic races, their growth rate is a function of production capacity.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M3_Terran_Dec
StringTable.String: Terrans are the inventors of hyperdrive and the youngest race on the galactic stage. Although committed diplomats, Terrans have a militaristic streak that has taken many by surprise.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M3_Terran_StartupDescription
StringTable.String:
The warning of the Last Dreadlord and the prophecies of the Altarians have convinced Colonel Jenna Casey that D.L. Bradley's campaign against the Drengin and continued use of the The Bane will cause the utter destruction of this Universe.
The only hope to end The Cycle of Draginol is to bring the last Shard of the Telenanth to D.L. Bradley and convince him to use it to neutralize the Bane before it is too late.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M3_Terran_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: With the fastest ships they could spare, Colonel Casey races to the edge of Terran space. Only to discover the Thalan Contingency blocking the only Hypergate leading to the First Fleet, their motives in doing so currently unknown.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M3_Thalan_Dec
StringTable.String: The Thalan Contingency have come from another universe, in the hopes of stopping what they call The Terran Crusade. Which they believe will lead to the destruction of the universe if left unchecked.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M3_Thalan_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Thalans are excellent researchers, extremely productive, and unfailingly militant. Their fertility is limited however, a possible side effect of living in an unfamiliar universe. And their distant and aloof nature makes them very unlikable.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M4_Terran_Dec
StringTable.String: Terrans are the inventors of hyperdrive and the youngest race on the galactic stage. Although committed diplomats, Terrans have a militaristic streak that has taken many by surprise.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M4_Terran_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: Colonel Jenna Casey has fought her way into the heart of the Drengin Empire to bring the Shard of the Telenanth to D.L. Bradley. However, Drengi and the devestating firepower of the Drengin armada stands between her and the First Fleet. While the battle around Drengi rages, she must reach the Crusader and convince it's commander to stop using the most powerful Precursor artifact ever known if there is to be any hope of saving this Universe.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M4_Terran_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Having secured a single colony to use as a base, Casey's small force is outnumbered and outgunned. The only hope remaining is that the Drengin are too busy holding back the First Fleet to notice the Valkyrie.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M4_Crusade_Dec
StringTable.String: Terrans are the inventors of hyperdrive and the youngest race on the galactic stage. Although committed diplomats, Terrans have a militaristic streak that has taken many by surprise.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M4_Crusade_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Terrans are naturally adventurous, with fast, long ranging ships. Their production capacity and diplomatic abilities are well regarded. Their ability to field large fleets is regarded with a bit more wariness.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M4_Drengin_Dec
StringTable.String: The Drengin are a profoundly evil and warlike civilization. Exceedingly clever and vicious, there are few beings capable of meeting a Drengin and not becoming its next meal.

StringTable.Label: EXP4_M4_Drengin_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Drengin soldiers are savagely effective at ground-based combat, and their naval vessels are famously tough. Their military manufacturing ability is also impressive, but Drengin colonies do sometimes struggle with discontent. Much of their famous inventiveness is put into stopping slaveling revolts.
